Given your context â€” spanning creativity, reflection, research, family life, remote work, ADHD, spirituality, voice memo processing, and a desire for deeper relational connection â€” here are **high-leverage AppleScripts** that could support your life beautifully by automating friction points and creating ambient nudges for meaning:

---

### ğŸğŸ“ **1. Auto-Organize & Rename Voice Memos by Date + Snippet**
You often reflect through voice memos. This script will:
- Rename files like `2025-04-23_Reflections_About_Belonging.m4a`
- Move them into folders by month/year
- (Optional: generate `.txt` files with transcription prompts)

```applescript
-- Rename and move voice memos
set memoFolder to "/Users/yourname/Desktop/VoiceMemos"
tell application "Finder"
	set memoFiles to every file of folder memoFolder whose name ends with ".m4a"
	repeat with f in memoFiles
		set oldName to name of f
		set creationDate to creation date of f
		set newName to (do shell script "date -j -f '%a %b %d %T %Z %Y' '" & creationDate & "' +'%Y-%m-%d'") & "_" & "Memo.m4a"
		set name of f to newName
		set newFolder to memoFolder & "/" & (do shell script "date -j -f '%a %b %d %T %Z %Y' '" & creationDate & "' +'%Y-%m'")
		if not (exists folder newFolder) then
			make new folder at memoFolder with properties {name:(do shell script "date -j -f '%a %b %d %T %Z %Y' '" & creationDate & "' +'%Y-%m'")}
		end if
		move f to folder newFolder
	end repeat
end tell
```

### ğŸ“¤ğŸ§  **3. Summarize and Email a Voice Memo**
Auto-forward a memo and summary to yourself or collaborators (useful for your TextRay project or thesis reflections).

```applescript
set memoPath to "/Users/yourname/Desktop/LatestMemo.m4a"
-- Optional: Use `transcribe` CLI or Whisper to generate a summary
set summaryText to "Summary: Need to explore connection between generosity and self/other collapse."
tell application "Mail"
	set newMessage to make new outgoing message with properties {subject:"ğŸ““ Voice Memo Summary", content:summaryText, visible:true}
	tell newMessage
		make new to recipient at end of to recipients with properties {address:"your@email.com"}
		make new attachment with properties {file name:memoPath as POSIX file} at after the last paragraph
	end tell
	send newMessage
end tell
```
